text: Optimization and scope for dehydropiperidyl boronate 4. Optimization of the cross-coupling between dehydropiperidyl boronate 4 and 4-bromoanisole is summarized in Table 2.
In two cases (32, 33), no erosion of enantiomeric purity was detected and coupled products were isolated with a 97.5:2.5 er.

The olefin of 34 was hydrogenated with diimide to provide the N-Boc-protected anabasine 37 in 95% yield without erosion of optical purity. Intermediate 37 can be transformed in a single high-yielding step to (þ)-anabasine (Fig. 5a).35Paroxetine is a highly prescribed antidepressant drug belonging to the class of selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors.

We accomplished a de novo catalytic enantioselective synthesis of (3S,4R)-(þ)-paroxetine from 4-aryl dehydropiperidine 38, the product of a a-regioselective (a/g¼ 11:1, separable) cross-coupling between boronate (S)-4 and 4-fluorophenyl bromide (Fig. 5b). This key coupling step was performed on a gram scale.

(a) Formal synthesis of (þ)-anabasine, a tobacco component and agonist of the nicotinic acetylcholine receptor. (b) Formal synthesis of (þ)-paroxetine, a synthetic antidepressant drug of the selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor class. a Product of a gram-scale reaction (with 1.4 g of (S)-4).

purification of both allylic boronates 3 and 4 was required prior to the cross-couplingreactions. When purified via flash chromatography, these air-sensitive allylic boronatestend to develop considerable affinity to the silica gel over time, resulting in a difficultpurification, especially on a small scale (below 0.5 mmol).

(34)By following the general procedure D, the title compound 34 was synthesized from(R)-4 and corresponding aryl bromide. The crude product, containing 34 as a mixture of15:1 regioisomers, was subjected to preparative TLC purification (50% ethylacetate/hexane) to afford the pure title compound with a 66% yield as a yellow oil:

(R,E)-tert-butyl 2-styryl-5,6-dihydropyridine-1(2H)-carboxylate (36)By following the general procedure D, the title compound 36 was synthesized from(S)-4 and corresponding aryl bromide. The crude product, containing 36 as a singleregioisomer, was subjected to preparative TLC purification (15% ethyl acetate/

Pinacol (520 mg, 4.4 mmol) was then added, and reactionmixture was stirred for 2 hours at room temperature. After removal of the solvent, theresidue was directly subjected to flash chromatography to afford the desired boronate39 as a clear oil with 61% overall yield.
